metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Data binding in AngularJS is the synchronization between the model and the view.
content.html: Data binding in AngularJS is the synchronization between the model and the view.

content.text: AngularJS applications usually have a data model. The data model is a collection of data available for the application.
content.html: AngularJS applications usually have a data model. The data model is a collection of data available for the application.

content.code_html:
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('myCtrl', function($scope) {
  $scope.firstname = "John";
  $scope.lastname = "Doe";
});

content.text: The HTML container where the AngularJS application is displayed, is called the view.
content.html: The HTML container where the AngularJS application is displayed, is called the view.

content.text: The view has access to the model, and there are several ways of displaying model data in the view.
content.html: The view has access to the model, and there are several ways of displaying model data in the view.

content.text: You can use the ng-bind directive, which will bind the innerHTML of the element to the specified model property:
content.html: You can use the ng-bind directive, which will bind the innerHTML of the element to the specified model property:

content.code_html: <p ng-bind="firstname"></p>

content.text: You can also use double braces {{ }} to display content from the model:
content.html: You can also use double braces {{ }} to display content from the model:

content.code_html: <p>First name: {{firstname}}</p>

content.text: Or you can use the ng-model directive on HTML controls to bind the model to the view.
content.html: Or you can use the ng-model directive on HTML controls to bind the model to the view.

content.text: Use the ng-model directive to bind data from the model to the view on HTML controls (input, select, textarea)
content.html: Use the ng-model directive to bind data from the model to the view on HTML controls (input, select, textarea)

content.code_html: <input ng-model="firstname">

content.text: The ng-model directive provides a two-way binding between the model and the view.
content.html: The ng-model directive provides a two-way binding between the model and the view.

content.text: Data binding in AngularJS is the synchronization between the model and the view.
content.html: Data binding in AngularJS is the synchronization between the model and the view.

content.text: When data in the model changes, the view reflects the change, and when data in the view changes, the model is updated as well. This happens immediately and automatically, which makes sure that the model and the view is updated at all times.
content.html: When data in the model changes, the view reflects the change, and when data in the view changes, the model is updated as well. This happens immediately and automatically, which makes sure that the model and the view is updated at all times.

content.code_html:
<div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="myCtrl">
  Name: <input ng-model="firstname">
  <h1>{{firstname}}</h1>
</div>

<script>
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('myCtrl', function($scope) {
  $scope.firstname = "John";
  $scope.lastname = "Doe";
});
</script>

content.text: Applications in AngularJS are controlled by controllers. Read about controllers in the AngularJS Controllers chapter.
content.html: Applications in AngularJS are controlled by controllers. Read about controllers in the AngularJS Controllers chapter.

content.text: Because of the immediate synchronization of the model and the view, the controller can be completely separated from the view, and simply concentrate on the model data. Thanks to the data binding in AngularJS, the view will reflect any changes made in the controller.
content.html: Because of the immediate synchronization of the model and the view, the controller can be completely separated from the view, and simply concentrate on the model data. Thanks to the data binding in AngularJS, the view will reflect any changes made in the controller.

content.code_html:
<div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="myCtrl">
  <h1 ng-click="changeName()">{{firstname}}</h1>
</div>

<script>
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('myCtrl', function($scope) {
  $scope.firstname = "John";
  $scope.changeName = function() {
    $scope.firstname = "Nelly";
  }
});
</script>
